stimulusHtml: A beta particle is initially moving in a straight-line path that will pass close to but not collide with a stationary particle that is negatively charged. What will happen to the beta particle as it passes near the stationary particle?
choicesHtml: The beta particle will move on a path that curves toward the charged particle.
The beta particle will move on a path that curves away from the charged particle.
The beta particle will move along a straight line and speed up.
The beta particle will move along a straight line and slow down.
